title: improve "method `XYZ` exists but the following trait bounds were not satisfied" error

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The error message has several problems:

## No obligation deduplication:

```Rust
fn main() {
    Some(()).into_iter().filter(|| false).collect();
}
```

This gives the following error:
```
rustc 1.19.0-nightly (f4209651e 2017-05-05)
error: no method named `collect` found for type `std::iter::Filter<std::option::IntoIter<()>, [closure@<anon>:2:33: 2:41]>` in the current scope
 --> <anon>:2:43
  |
2 |     Some(()).into_iter().filter(|| false).collect();
  |                                           ^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: the method `collect` exists but the following trait bounds were not satisfied: `[closure@<anon>:2:33: 2:41] : std::ops::FnMut<(&_,)>`, `std::iter::Filter<std::option::IntoIter<()>, [closure@<anon>:2:33: 2:41]> : std::iter::Iterator`

error[E0593]: closure takes 0 arguments but 1 argument is required
 --> <anon>:2:26
  |
2 |     Some(()).into_iter().filter(|| false).collect();
  |                          ^^^^^^ -------- takes 0 arguments
  |                          |
  |                          expected closure that takes 1 argument
```

The 2 errors - `[closure@<anon>:2:33: 2:41] : std::ops::FnMut<(&_,)>` and `std::iter::Filter<std::option::IntoIter<()>, [closure@<anon>:2:33: 2:41]> : std::iter::Iterator` - are implied by the same cause, which is also an existing error. There's no reason to report both of them.
